item.text: Abstractly physics-based Rube Goldberg machine simulator series, demanding players arrange common household objects in elaborate configurations to effect simple state changes.
Abstractly physics-based Rube Goldberg machine simulator series, demanding players arrange common household objects in elaborate configurations to effect simple state changes.

Computer Gaming World (1993) praised The Incredible Machine, stating that while the 80 puzzles "are a blast" the Free Form Mode was the game's best feature; "the curious, tinkering 10-year-old is re-awakened, given a digital toy box and set loose in the backyard of his or her mind".

The magazine concluded that the game was "one of the most innovative and deceptively addicting products to pass this way in quite a while ... a well-oiled imagination machine with a very broad appeal".
Abstractly physics-based [[Rube Goldberg Machine]] simulator series, demanding players arrange common household objects in elaborate configurations to effect simple state changes.

Computer Gaming World (1993) praised The Incredible Machine, stating that while the 80 puzzles "are a blast" the Free Form Mode was the game's best feature; "the curious, tinkering 10-year-old is re-awakened, given a digital toy box and set loose in the backyard of his or her mind" - [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Incredible_Machine_%28series%29#The_Incredible_Machine  wikipedia]

The magazine concluded that the game was "one of the most innovative and deceptively addicting products to pass this way in quite a while ... a well-oiled imagination machine with a very broad appeal"  - [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Incredible_Machine_%28series%29#The_Incredible_Machine  wikipedia]

Computer Gaming World (1993) praised The Incredible Machine, stating that while the 80 puzzles "are a blast" the Free Form Mode was the game's best feature; "the curious, tinkering 10-year-old is re-awakened, given a digital toy box and set loose in the backyard of his or her mind".

A Rube Goldberg machine is a contraption, invention, device or apparatus that is deliberately over-engineered or overdone to perform a very simple task in a very complicated fashion, usually including a chain reaction.
item.title: Rube Goldberg Machine
